lead_paragraph: BARNET--Sylvan. The Trustees and staff of The Metropolitan Museum of Art mourn the passing of Sylvan Barnet, an esteemed Benefactor and generous donor to the Museum. With his late partner William Burto, he donated the 17 important Chinese and Japanese hanging scrolls, dating from the 12th to the 17th century, featured in the Met's 2002 exhibition "The Written Image: Japanese Calligraphy and Painting from the Sylvan Barnet and William Burto Collection." These scrolls are treasured enhancements to the Museum's extensive holdings of Asian art, and will continue to provide a great benefit to scholars and the general public for generations to come. Daniel Brodsky, Chairman Thomas P. Campbell, Director and CEO Daniel H. Weiss, President 1/3
